Nation

Beijing confirms two more COVID-19 cases

Two new cases of COVID-19 were confirmed in Beijing on Friday, after another case was reported a day earlier, according to the municipal government.

Nation

China's hard-hit Hubei to further lower COVID-19 emergency response

China's Hubei Province, once hit hard by COVID-19, will lower its emergency response from level II to III starting Saturday, a local official announced Friday.

6h 0

Link: /news/nation/2006120069/

Nation

Beijing suspends class resumption after new COVID-19 cases

Beijing Friday suspended the class resumption for primary schools' lower graders after three new confirmed COVID-19 cases were reported in the capital city over the past two days.

Link: /news/nation/2006120065/

Making a strong case for communal approach to health

There is now general consensus that regular and frequent physical exercise is an important means to develop and maintain health.

Wellness

Fitness industry bent into new shape after epidemic

Gyms and fitness studios were hard hit by the novel coronavirus, but in an innovation that seems set to stay, they adapted with online classes.

Tech

Chipmaking revenue up 23 percent in Q2: report

Semiconductor manufacturers pulled in US$18.9 billion as the pandemic propelled demand from 5G networks, computer upgrades and devices for remote work.

Link: /biz/tech/2006120066/

Nation

Close contacts of Beijing's new COVID-19 case test negative

The two close contacts of Beijing's newly reported COVID-19 case tested negative in nucleic acid and antibody testing, local health authorities said on Friday.

Link: /news/nation/2006120048/

Nation

Chinese mainland reports 7 new confirmed COVID-19 cases

Chinese health authority said on Friday that it received reports of seven new confirmed COVID-19 cases on the Chinese mainland on Thursday, of which six were imported.

Nation

Xi calls for coordinated efforts to promote China-Philippines cooperation

Chinese President Xi Jinping suggested on Thursday that China and the Philippines devise innovative approaches and methods while conducting COVID-19 control on an ongoing basis.
